sources.data_found: Torch spec sheet: H200 GPU nodes=29 with total GPUs=232; L40S GPU nodes=68 with total GPUs=272.
TOP500 system page for 'Greene-H100' lists CPU cores=9,360 and indicates NVIDIA H100 80GB.
Lenovo ThinkSystem SD665-N V3 datasheet: 'Acceleration: NVIDIA HGX H100 or H200 4-GPU ... SXM5 GPUs' (i.e., 4 GPUs per node, SXM form factor).
Greene (NYU HPC) hardware summary includes total GPU cards=368 with breakdown: 292 RTX8000 (48GB) and 76 V100 (32GB). Also lists GPU node counts: 73 RTX8000 GPU nodes and 20 V100 GPU nodes.
HSRN Kubernetes Cluster hardware overview lists 14 NVIDIA GPUs (models not specified).
Radiology Condo: 10 four-way GPU nodes, each with four NVIDIA A100 GPUs (=> 40 A100 total). Also states Skynet has 192 NVIDIA V100 GPUs.
BigPurple: 87 GPU-containing nodes with total of 376 GPUs; mentions both NVIDIA Tesla V100 and NVIDIA A100 are implemented but does not provide a count split.

student_data.notes: Searched for NYU Computer Science (Courant/CAS) and NYU Tandon CSE enrollment counts explicitly labeled with 2024+ (e.g., “Fall 2024”, “2024-2025”, “AY 2024-25”). Checked NYU CS site pages (Undergraduates overview/major pages; Masters overview/MSCS pages; PhD overview pages) and NYU Tandon CSE department pages; none report headcount/enrollment totals for CS majors/MS/PhD with an explicit Fall 2024 or AY 2024-25 label (they provide program descriptions/requirements, calendars, resources, etc., but no enrollment numbers). Found NYU Tandon ‘Fast Facts’ with overall Tandon enrollment explicitly for Fall 2024 (https://engineering.nyu.edu/about/fast-facts) but it is school-wide (not CS-specific), so rejected. Found NYU Bulletins ‘Enrollment and Graduation Statistics’ (https://bulletins.nyu.edu/nyu/enrollment-graduation-statistics/) but it explicitly reports enrollment as of Fall 2022, so rejected per requirement. Found references online to an NYU Common Data Set 2024-2025 PDF, but (a) CDS typically does not provide CS-program enrollment headcounts, and (b) the official PDF link could not be fetched/verified in this session due to an access error, so it was not usable as a working, verifiable source for CS enrollment counts.

other_high_vram_gpus.model: NVIDIA GPU (model not specified, HSRN Kubernetes pilot)

gpu_resources.notes: Clusters included: (1) NYU Torch: H200=29 nodes * 8 GPUs/node = 232; L40S=68 nodes * 4 GPUs/node = 272. (2) NYU Greene-H100 (TOP500 'Greene-H100'): cores=9,360; assuming 48 CPU-cores per node => 9,360/48=195 nodes; Lenovo SD665-N V3 uses HGX H100 4-GPU SXM5 per node => 195*4=780 H100 SXM (ASSUMPTION: TOP500 entry does not publish GPU count; this derives node count from CPU cores and assumes every node is a 4xH100 SXM5 node). (3) NYU Greene (general HPC): RTX8000 total=292 (implies ~73 nodes * 4 GPUs/node = 292); V100 total=76 (node count listed as 20, but GPUs/node not stated; total used directly). (4) Hudson (now part of Greene): 20 nodes * 8 MI50/node = 160 (AMD; recorded under other_high_vram_gpus). (5) HSRN Kubernetes: 14 NVIDIA GPUs total (model unspecified). (6) NYU Langone Radiology Condo: 10 nodes * 4 A100/node = 40 (A100 memory size not stated; counted as A100 40GB by age/typical config assumption). (7) NYU Langone Skynet: 192 V100 total. (8) NYU Langone BigPurple: 87 GPU nodes with 376 GPUs total; GPU split between V100/A100 not stated, so ALL 376 counted as V100 (older=V100 assumption, cluster went live July 2018). Totals: H100_SXM=780; H200=232; L40S=272; A100_40GB=40; V100=76+192+376=644.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
